content.description: Start low matched on crimp with feet to the left(big ledge at the bottom is on for feet). Move up the right arete and gain sloper to then traverse left on smooth crimps and topout on slab.
content.location: Look for two smooth crimps on the lip of the backside of the boulder. Start on the lowest crimp below in the overhang.

content.description: Climbs straight up the tallest vertical wall on the boulder. Sit start on two smaller crimps with good feet, climb straight up into jugs to top-out on tallest point of boulder.
content.location: From Unknown, keep moving left around the boulder until there is a hole leading to Mychotic Break. Start directly to the right of that hole.

content.description: Start on big jugs and move left into crimps/slopers and knee bar. Gain top of break and then move to high jug left on middle of face. Top out either straight up or to right.
content.location: Look for big jugs on the downhill side of the boulder to the left of "Mycotic Break".

content.description: Starts uphill of break and joins "Need a knee" at top of break. Topout the same.
content.location: Starts directly next to "Need a knee".

content.description: SDS low in overhang and climb straight up into vertical headwall. Be careful not to dab on tree for last few moves. One of the best problems in Parkway.
content.location: The most obvious line on the largest overhang of the boulder.

content.description: The main boulder of "Mushroom Area" and home to "Mycotic Break" (V9). One of the larger boulders in the area with a slab top and decent overhangs.
